He highlighted the NDA's development agenda, contrasting it with the RJD's alleged promotion of crime and corruption among youth, urging voters to choose progress over the past.

title: In Israel, Zohran Mamdani's win in New York stirs alarm over shifting U.S. attitudes
description: Israeli PM Netanyahu did not immediately comment on the Mamdani win. But his office tried Wednesday (November 5) to remind Israelis that the country's relationship with the U.S. was still strong

title: Delhi airport tech snag: Normalcy restored a day after 800+ flight delays; advisory issued
description: Operations at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport have returned to normal following a technical glitch in the Air Traffic Control's flight planning system. The issue, which affected the Automatic Message Switching System, led to widespread flight delays yesterday. Authorities are working to minimize passenger inconvenience.

title: Typhoon Kalmaegi rampages across Vietnam as Philippines prepares for new storm
description: As the storm moved on, recovery work began in battered towns and villages in both countries. Across central Vietnamese provinces, people cleared debris and repaired roofs on their homes

title: Watch | Bihar’s Job Crisis: Why are so many young people unemployed?
description:
In Bihar, thousands of young people are still waiting for jobs that never come.
Paper leaks, delayed exams and a collapsing education system have left a generation in limbo.

This ground report looks at Bihar’s growing youth job crisis and what happens when years of preparation lead to nothing.

From Patna to rural Bihar, young aspirants share their struggles, their hopes and what it means to keep studying when the system keeps failing.
Their stories reveal how unemployment in Bihar has become not just an economic problem, but an emotional one about dignity, direction and survival.

Watch to understand why so many young people in Bihar are still unemployed, and what their long wait says about India’s future.

description: A dramatic robbery attempt at a Ranip jewellery shop ended in failure. A woman threw chilli powder at the owner to steal valuables. The powder missed its target. The shop owner reacted swiftly. He struck the woman multiple times before pushing her out. CCTV footage of the incident has gone viral. Police are searching for the woman and investigating further.

description: Bill Gates, a Harvard dropout and education advocate, emphasizes that success transcends academic intelligence. He advises students to choose their peers wisely, surrounding themselves with those who challenge and inspire them. Furthermore, Gates stresses the importance of recognizing and appreciating diverse talents, acknowledging that a blend of skills, not just high IQ, is crucial for a richer life and career.

title: 'Mistakenly applied': LJP (RV) MP inked on both fingers after polls; admin responds

title: What happens if you fall into a blackhole, spaghettification explained
description: Falling into a black hole means facing extreme stretching, known as spaghettification, due to immense tidal forces. While supermassive black holes might allow crossing the event horizon intact, destruction is inevitable near the singularity. Scientists study this process to test physics boundaries and understand cosmic events, revealing insights into gravity and information paradoxes.

In the detailed statement after the ICC Board meeting, the sport's global body mentioned the success of women's cricket and also shared an update on the LA28 Games.

title: Candace Owens thanks Daily Wire after being fired as her podcast becomes world’s No. 1
description: Candace Owens states her podcast is now the world's number one show. She credits her firing from The Daily Wire for this success. Owens was dismissed in March 2024 after criticizing Israel's actions in Gaza. She believes the separation brought her significant publicity. Her new show is now topping global podcast charts.

title: Land deal case: Trouble for Pawar's son? Firm told to pay stamp duty of Rs 21cr with penalty
description: Authorities have demanded Rs 21 crore in stamp duty and penalty from Amadea Enterprises LLP for a cancelled 40-acre land deal in Mundhwa. The firm, co-partnered by Parth Pawar, had sought stamp duty exemption for a data centre project, but its cancellation has nullified the concession. The sub-registrar insists on full payment before re-submitting the cancellation deed.

title: 'Mentally tortured': 30-year-old woman found dead; husband, 6 in-laws booked for murder
description: A 30-year-old woman was found dead under suspicious circumstances in Faridabad, with preliminary findings suggesting strangulation. Her mother has registered a murder case against her husband and six relatives, alleging continuous harassment and threats. The deceased had reportedly called her mother the day before her death, stating she was being troubled and threatened.

title: Canada’s new immigration plan: PM Carney to H-1B holders; says their skills will drive future growth
description: Canada is rolling out a new immigration strategy, aiming to attract over 1,000 top researchers with a $1.2 billion investment. The nation plans to welcome 380,000 permanent residents annually from 2026-2028.  An accelerated pathway for H-1B visa holders is also in the works, potentially drawing skilled professionals from the US.

title: Apple's CarPlay Ultra: Automakers in split with adoption; Ford CEO warns of overreach
description: Ford CEO Jim Farley expressed strong concerns about Apple's CarPlay Ultra, fearing it encroaches too deeply into vehicle control. He questioned how far Apple's brand should extend into car functions, emphasizing the digital experience as a key differentiator for future vehicles. This follows similar reservations from other automakers and GM's decision to drop both CarPlay and Android Auto.

title: Future of AI: 'I would have dropped out if...'; Nvidia CEO's message to Zuckerberg
description: Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on AI's future and building tech empires. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out like Zuckerberg, while both acknowledged their long journeys and mutual admiration. Nvidia's remarkable rise to a $5 trillion valuation was highlighted, contrasting with Zuckerberg's own dorm-room beginnings leading to Meta's trillion-dollar status.
